alert.note: Alert for Burke (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 8:48PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: .Heavy rain over portions of the Savannah River Site and vicinity. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia, including the following county, Burke. Portions of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Aiken and Barnwell. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 845 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Savannah River Site Law Enforcement reported that Highway 125, southeast of D Area, and south of K Area, is covered by some water. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Plant Vogtle, Savannah River Site K Complex and Shell Bluff Landing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in this area. Turn around, don`t drown.
